element.name: DESCRIPTION
element.text:
This algorithm fills pits and sinks from a DEM. This process should be performed before doing any hydrological analysis with a DEM. Otherwise, flow directions cannot be calculated on some cells, and this results in wrong calculations of hydrological parameters such as flow accumulation.
Pits and sinks are replaced by an inclined plane.

element.name: ADDITIONAL_INFO
element.text: * O. Planchon and F. Darboux. A fast, simple and versatile algorithm to fill the depressions of digital elevation models. Catena, 46:159-176, 2001.

element.name: MINSLOPE
element.text: The angle of the inclined plane used to substitute pits and sinks.

element.name: RESULT
element.text: The sink-filled DEM. Thise DEM can be safely used for all hydrological analisis.
